intro: Ligusticella eastwoodiae, commonly known as Eastwood's wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its aromatic compounds. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, often disagreeable odor. Ligusticella eastwoodiae is typically found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
